p: Diarrhea is one of the most prevalent conditions affecting the gastrointestinal tract worldwide, contributing significantly to morbidity and mortality of the population[ 1]. The prevalence of chronic diarrhea is estimated at 1%-5% of the adult population, and in developed countries[ 2]. This condition can be defined as water and electrolyte loss caused by an increase in defecation frequency and abnormality in stool consistency throughout three or more times over 24 h[ 3- 5].
